ch.epfl.alpano

Interface Azimuth


  • public interface Azimuth
    This class contains methods to manipulate numbers representing azimuts expressed in radians.
    Author:
    Martin Cibils (261746), Jeremy Mion (261178)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double canonicalize(double azimuth)
      Transforms any angle to an angle between [0, 2*pi[.
      static double fromMath(double angle)
      Converts a mathematical angle into an azimuth angle.

      Determines if azimuth is within the rage of [0;2*pi[.

      Converts a azimuth angle to a mathematical angle

    • Method Detail

      • isCanonical

        static boolean isCanonical(double azimuth)
        Determines if azimuth is within the rage of [0;2*pi[.
        Parameters:
        azimuth - The angle that needs to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if azimuth is contained in [0; 2*pi[ otherwise false.

      • canonicalize

        static double canonicalize(double azimuth)
        Transforms any angle to an angle between [0, 2*pi[.
        Parameters:
        azimuth - The angle to transform into a angle between [0, 2*pi[.
        Returns:
        A double which is the azimuth expressed between [0 , 2*pi[.

      • toMath

        static double toMath(double azimuth)
        Converts a azimuth angle to a mathematical angle

        Changes the angle from clockwise to anti-clockwise.

        Parameters:
        azimuth - Angle to be converted into a mathematical angle.
        Returns:
        The angle in radiant as a mathematical angle.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if azimuth is not canonical.

      • fromMath

        static double fromMath(double angle)
        Converts a mathematical angle into an azimuth angle.
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle to be converted into a azimuth angle.
        Returns:
        An angle in radiant as a mathematical angle.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If angle is not canonical.

      • toOctantString

        static java.lang.String toOctantString(double azimuth,
                                       java.lang.String n,
                                       java.lang.String e,
                                       java.lang.String s,
                                       java.lang.String w)
        Determines the octant that the angle is in.

        The different strings can be grouped together to represent NE SE NW SW.

        Parameters:
        azimuth - The angle used to determine what octant it is in.
        n - String to show if the angle is pointing north.
        e - String to show if the angle is pointing north.
        s - String to show if the angle is pointing north.
        w - String to show if the angle is pointing north.
        Returns:
        The representation of which octant the azimuth is in.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If azimuth is not canonical.
